ExTexGen
========

Existing Text Generator
Pierre Chevalier - 2013
http://www.lilinx.com/

Re-writing an existing text (for example, Ennius' Annals) by randomly combining letters.
The generator uses Google's synth voice to read aloud its best results.
Existing Text Generator simulates a thought experiment initially described by Cicero.
Learn more about ExTexGen : http://www.lilinx.com/extexgen/

ExTexGen is case unsensitive and plays only with a fixed set of 21 characters (all letters).

This repository hosts two different scripts :

ExTexGen1.py (method 1)
------------------------
Accepts any string of characters that matches the beginning of Ennius' Annals first verse.
Examples of valid results : "e", "ex", "excita", "excitacumtremul", etc. 
Compares its results to Ennius' Annals first verse :
"excitacumtremulisanusattulitartubuslumen"



ExTexGen2.py (method 2)
-------------------------
Accepts any string of character  present at any point of the reference text.
Examples of valid results : "i", "t", "co", "locisd", "volotmnesav", etc.
Compares its results to a large sample from the Annals :

"!OpaterogenitorosanguendisoriundumTuproduxistinosintraluminisorasRomulusincaelocumdisgenitalibusaevumQuispotisingentisorasevolverebelli??Sedquidegohicanimolamentor?~?."
